Articles.Content:
ATTENTION EVERYONE!

I did some testing today - and the version you've all downloaded is flawed The download has been updated, so just re-download it and overwrite the old file and it should be better.

The problem was due to the fact that I fed the fuel straight through the orbital engines - which may save the fuel in the tanks, but it also messes up the COM of the Shutte-tank system after SRB separation. Now, it drains the onboard tanks but keeps the ship flying straight Also, one of the two orange tanks in the hold must be converted to fuel for the engines in order to deorbit. I will fix it soon, but for the moment this hotfix will get you to orbit and back. Unfortunately, I wasted a good 45 minutes figuring it out, so the flight manual will have to wait for tomorrow But i promise, it's coming... but you must remember even I'm struggling to fly this thing

Here's a nice picture.

I.. I got nothing. This thing is beautiful. Even my computer is weeping in awe.

Oh, wait, that's not awe. It's fear. It knows I'll try it at least once. :-P
words failed me a while back lol. this thing is just staggeringly beautiful

Zekes.....I.......don't.........even.....know.

AWESOME
Thanks so much guys it seems it doesn't really matter if it flies, but I will keep banging my head against the wall until it does
Among other things, I'm going to add a crew cockpit and ejection seats into the shuttle.

Zekes I've said this a few times now: Size isn't everything...

I have to quote...

Nice replica anyway

Does this flying brickyard land? I'm looking forward to testing this beast out.

I will install kerbpaint just because of this.

Edited December 9, 2014 by inigma

Does this flying brickyard land? I'm looking forward to testing this beast out.

I will install kerbpaint just because of this.

I'm working on a video of it right now - it's actually really light on landing ( i can get it down to 25 m/s on flare)
Where do you even land this thing? The runway is not big enough, and even the slightest slopes should not be too good for that beast.

Where do you even land this thing? The runway is not big enough, and even the slightest slopes should not be too good for that beast.

actually, you'd be surprised - as I was surprised - about how easy it is to land. I worked very hard on the aerodynamics I can slow her down to 25 m/s even, and i've performed a landing on rough terrain.... should be easy to hit the runway, as long as you don't miss, there's no going around!

One final unmanned test of the shuttle, and it worked! Download is good and video is being edited right now. STS-01 and -03 were catastrophic failures, so I reverted the ship to STS-02 status and went from there. It was nominal, which was good.

Javascript is disabled. View full album
Well. Okay then.
Here's the landing - touchdown speed was 20.7 m/s and at night, on a 10 degree slope.

MUHAHAHA LOL ROTFLOL HAHAHAHAHAHAHA HAHHAHAH HHAHHAA HAHABABba oooohhh MUhHAHAHHAHAHA LOLLOLOLOL BANGS FIST HAHAHA...

This download is worth it just for the explosions!! Pics soon.

+1 rep x 1000

awesome craft.

You should rename this monster the honorable nickname of Up Goer 1300.

I reworked some of the fuel lines, and redid some of the orbital fuel bays..... that will be ready when I update the download soon.

I did some testing of ejection seats, but they're hard to install, and the crew compartment has a good chance of surviving most crashes anyway, tests show.

Some jettesonable cockpits have been added as well, to facilitate crew entry into the vehicle.

I did some testing of ejection seats, but they're hard to install, and the crew compartment has a good chance of surviving most crashes anyway, tests show.

Really? Like nosing into the ground is survivable?

Scariest shuttle EVA 8-O

I like the giant separatron.

Scariest shuttle EVA 8-O

I like the giant separatron.

Thanks

Really? Like nosing into the ground is survivable?

tests show that 75% of the internal cockpit seats survive direct impact of the nose of the orbiter with the ground... plus, I had a launch failure yesterday, the ship fell in on itself, and the test pilot walked away without injury despite the fact that the orbiter was completely destroyed .

Edited December 10, 2014 by zekes
This is absolutely stunning. My computer is starting to smoke just thinking about trying to run this. You must have spent hours and hours on this!

This is absolutely stunning. My computer is starting to smoke just thinking about trying to run this. You must have spent hours and hours on this!

Thank you Gus, you're the first person to realize how long this took to get wokring (about 20 hours).... but I think it's worth it

Why did you have to post this before I got mine uploaded... Mine is a bit larger just flimsy... I feel like I copied you. It looks like it took more than 20 hours, I couldn't get mine to stop bending at the tank.

Edited December 10, 2014 by LABHOUSE

Why did you have to post this before I got mine uploaded... Mine is a bit larger just flimsy... I feel like I copied you. It looks like it took more than 20 hours, I couldn't get mine to stop bending at the tank.

BIGGER? HERESY! We shall see XD (can i see screenshots?)

also, tip for flying the shuttle:

Edited December 11, 2014 by zekes
Made some cool shots of the Orbiter! also, DOWNLOAD UPDATED ONCE AGAIN! Now, the fuel should flow a bit better in the upper stages.

I know exactly what you've gone through in developing this beast. I've been through it several times myself. Nice job.

But seriously... why no procedural wings? Use that one mod, just that one, and your shuttle will look smooth. Your part count will be a fraction of what it is currently. Your shuttle will look better and perform better.
